content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

Certainly! Here's a function that does exactly that:

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    lines = split(md, '\n')
    question_started = false
    answer_started = false
    q_text = ""
    a_text = ""

    for l in lines
        if !question_started && startswith(l, "# Question")
            question_started = true
        elseif question_started && !startswith(l, " ")
            q_text *= l
            if endswith(q_text, "\n") || endswith(q_text, "\r")
                q_text = strip(q_text)
                question_started = false
            end
        end
        
        if !answer_started && startswith(l, "# Answer")
            answer_started = true
        elseif answer_started && !startswith(l, " ")
            a_text *= l
            if endswith(a_text, "\n") || endswith(a_text, "\r")
                a_text = strip(a_text)
                answer_started = false
            end
        end
    end
    
    return (q_text, a_text)
end
```

This function `q_and_a_extractor` will take a markdown-formatted text as input and return a tuple containing the question and answer, stripped of any leading spaces and newlines.
